translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The Numerical Order of the Paṭṭhāna

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (2)🔽20.3. Āsavagocchaka🔽Naāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽noāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavo ca noāsavo ca
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma  āsavagocchaka  na āsavam dhammam paṭicca āsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā na āsavam dhammam paṭicca  noāsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na āsavam dhammam paṭicca āsavaḥ ca noāsavaḥ ca
translated: The Section on the Corruptions’ Range

original: dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nanoāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nanoāsavaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca āsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nanoāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavo ca noāsavo
analyzed: dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi  na no āsavam dhammam paṭicca no āsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na no āsavam dhamma  paṭicca āsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na noāsavam dhammam paṭicca āsavaḥ ca noāsavaḥ
translated: With a non-corruption as condition there arises a corruption. With a non-corruption as condition there arises a non-corruption. With a non-corruption as condition there arise a corruption and a non-corruption. … three triplets.

analyzed: ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a non-corruption as condition there arises a non-corruption. With a non-corruption as condition there arises a corruption. With a non-corruption as condition there arise a corruption and a non-corruption. … three triplets.

original: Naāsavañca nanoāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na āsavañca na no āsavañca dhammam paṭicca āsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a non-corruption and a corruption as condition there arises a corruption. … three triplets. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyāḥ nava pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava
translated: In the section on root cause there are nine. … In the section on kamma result there is one. … In the section on the unformed there are nine.

original: Nasāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasāsavaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca anāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sāsavo ca
analyzed: na sa āsavam dhammam paṭicca sa āsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sa āsavam dhamma  paṭicca anāsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sa āsavam dhammam paṭicca sa āsavaḥ ca
translated: With a non-contaminating object, a contaminating consciousness arises. With a non-contaminating object, a non-contaminating consciousness arises. With a non-contaminating object, a contaminating and a non-contaminating consciousness arise.

original: anāsavo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Naanāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: anāsavo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi  na anāsavam dhammam paṭicca sa āsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: With a non-outflow dhamma as condition, an outflow dhamma arises – by way of root condition. With a non-outflow dhamma as condition, an outflow-free dhamma arises – by way of root condition. With a non-outflow dhamma as condition, an outflow dhamma and an outflow-free dhamma arise – by way of root condition. (Three.)🔽With an outflow-free dhamma as condition, an outflow dhamma arises – by way of root condition. (One.)

original: Nasāsavañca naanāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca sāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sa āsavañca na anāsavañca dhammam paṭicca sa āsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an outflow-free and an outflow-free dhamma as condition, an outflow dhamma arises – by way of root condition. (One.) (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca …pe… ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca pe ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca
translated: With root cause, there are five … With object, there are two … With non-hindrance, there are five.

original: Naāsavasampayuttaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavasampayutto dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na āsava sampayuttam dhammam paṭicca āsava sampayuttaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a dhamma associated with an outflow as condition, a dhamma associated with an outflow arises – by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe cha …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe cha pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava
translated: With root cause, there are nine … With object, there are six … With nutriment, there are nine … With result, there is one … With non-hindrance, there are nine.

original: Naāsavañceva anāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavo ceva sāsavo ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na āsavam ca iva anāsavam ca dhammam paṭicca āsavaḥ ca iva sa āsavaḥ ca dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an outflow-free and an outflow-free dhamma as condition, an outflow and an outflow-free dhamma arises – by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyāḥ nava pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava
translated: … with nine as root-cause … … with one as kamma-result … … with nine as an object of non-ill-will …

original: Naāsavañceva naāsavavippayuttañca dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavo ceva āsavasampayutto ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na āsavañca iva na āsava vippayuttañca dhammam paṭicca āsavaḥ ca iva āsava sampayutto ca dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-contaminant and non-contaminant- dissociated state as condition, a contaminant and a state associated with a contaminant arise, by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.)
… with nine as root-cause … … with nine as an object of non-ill-will …

original: Āsavavippayuttaṁ nasāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca āsavavippayutto sāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: āsava vippayuttam na sa āsavam dhammam paṭicca āsava vippayuttaḥ sa āsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a state dissociated from contaminants and not subject to cankers as condition, a state dissociated from contaminants and subject to cankers arises, by way of root-cause condition. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca
translated: … with five as object … … with five as an object of non-ill-will …
